kushkipagos 1.1.0 API

Welcome to the Kushki Java library documentation; the methods you need to use in order to integrate with Kushki are documented in the Kushki class.

See: Description

Packages 
Package Description
com.kushkipagos  

Welcome to the Kushki Java library documentation; the methods you need to use in order to integrate with Kushki are documented in the Kushki class.

Quickstart

1. Download the library

Using Gradle: Include this code in your build.gradle file, replacing $VERSION with the version of the library to be installed: 

apply plugin: 'java'
sourceCompatibility = 1.7
repositories {
    jcenter() // alternatively, mavenCentral()
}
dependencies {
    compile 'com.kushkipagos:kushkipagos:$VERSION'
}

Using Maven: Include this code in your pom.xml file, replacing $VERSION with the version of the library to be installed: 

<dependencies>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.kushkipagos</groupId>
        <artifactId>kushkipagos</artifactId>
        <version>$VERSION</version>
    </dependency>
</dependencies>

2. Instantiate a Kushki object

String merchantId = "REPLACE-WITH-YOUR-PRIVATE-MERCHANT-ID";
String language = "es";
String currency = "USD";
KushkiEnvironment environment = KushkiEnvironment.TESTING; // or KushkiEnvironment.PRODUCTION
Kushki kushki = new Kushki(merchantId, language, currency, environment);

3. Use the Kushki object

Use the following methods to interact with Kushki:

  • Kushki.charge(java.lang.String, com.kushkipagos.Amount)
  • Kushki.deferredCharge(java.lang.String, com.kushkipagos.Amount, java.lang.Integer)
  • Kushki.voidCharge(java.lang.String, com.kushkipagos.Amount)
  • Kushki.requestToken(com.kushkipagos.Card, java.lang.Double)
